summary: Build a customer registration app for Star Maharashtra Galaxy Internet with multi-step registration, document verification, terms acceptance, and OTP verification.
architectural_notes: Registration is a 4-step flow: Details -> Document Upload -> Terms -> OTP Verification
Add an Admin Panel for viewing saved registrations, restricted to a single admin user (access control mechanism TBD).
Add an animated splash screen shown on app launch before navigating to the main registration flow/admin panel.
Splash/intro screen should remove the logo and instead display the company name in stylized/design lettering (text-based branding).
Splash screen company name text (no logo) should use an updated font and include color styling.
Add conditional receipt upload: when Payment Option = Online, require user to upload a payment-success receipt photo (PhonePe/Google Pay) before completing registration.
Provide a printable/exportable Terms & Conditions proof for the customer (e.g., print dialog / downloadable receipt) from the Terms step after acceptance.
Splash/intro screen animation background should use a space/galaxy blue color theme.
known_issues: Customer Details page is not opening (user reports it 'again' not opening).
Admin Panel: customer details/registration detail ("customer id") page is not opening and the "Edit" option is not appearing.

existing_features.title: Create a multi-step customer registration flow for “Star Maharashtra Galaxy Internet” with 4 steps: (1) Customer Details, (2) Verification Documents, (3) Terms and Conditions, (4) OTP Verification. Use English for all user-facing UI text.

Implement Step 1 (Customer Details) form fields and validations: First Name, Middle Name, Surname, Phone Number, Date of Birth, Email ID, Address; Customer Category (Residential/Commercial); Payment Option (Cash/UPI); Router Provision (Provided Free of Cost/Chargeable). Ensure required fields are validated before allowing navigation to Step 2.

Implement Step 2 (Verification Documents) to allow uploading exactly two document copies: Aadhaar Card and PAN Card. The UI must show selected file name(s), allow replacing/removing a selected file before submission, and block moving to Step 3 until both documents are provided.
Implement Step 3 (Terms and Conditions) page displaying the provided terms as readable bullet points/sections and require explicit user agreement (checkbox) before proceeding to Step 4.

Implement Step 4 (OTP Verification) UI with: mobile number input (prefilled from Step 1 but editable if needed), “Generate OTP” action, OTP input, and “Verify” action. Display clear status and error messages for OTP generation and verification.

Implement backend OTP generation and verification: generate a 6-digit OTP tied to a phone number with a short expiry, store it temporarily in canister state, and verify user-submitted OTP. Because external SMS sending is not available, the system must not attempt any SMS integration; OTP delivery must be simulated via UI messaging only.

Implement frontend-backend wiring with React Query so the registration flow submits data to the canister only after OTP verification succeeds; handle loading/error states and prevent double submissions.

Define and apply a coherent visual theme for the app (colors, typography, spacing, form layout) appropriate for an ISP customer onboarding experience, consistently across all 4 steps. Avoid a blue/purple-dominant palette.
Implement an Admin Panel in the frontend that allows the single admin to view customer submissions (registrations) in a readable list and inspect individual submission details.
Add React Query wiring for admin operations (claim admin access, fetch registrations list, fetch single registration) with clear loading and error states and prevention of accidental double actions.
Update the Admin Panel “Access Denied” experience to help users recover admin access when they are authenticated but not recognized as admin, by providing an in-page admin setup/reset flow.
Implement frontend logic to apply an Admin Setup Code by storing it in session storage under the key "caffeineAdminToken" and re-initializing access control without editing immutable hook files.
Make the Admin Panel display a clear “Signed in as: <principal>” status and an “Admin: Yes/No” status once authenticated, to remove confusion about whether the current Internet Identity is the admin.

Add an in-page 'Reset Admin Setup Code' action to the Admin Panel access-denied recovery UI that calls the backend reset endpoint, shows the newly generated code to the user, and provides clear English instructions to copy/store it safely.

After a successful admin code reset, automatically apply the new code by storing it in sessionStorage under the key "caffeineAdminToken", re-initializing access control, and refreshing admin-related React Query state so the Admin Panel loads without requiring a manual page refresh.

Update the Admin Panel recovery UI to show clear, actionable error messaging when Admin Setup Code reset fails (for example, due to being signed in with the wrong Internet Identity), including instructions in English to sign out and sign back in with the correct admin Internet Identity and then retry.

Ensure the reset success path reliably re-initializes admin access after the new Admin Setup Code is generated by: (1) storing it under `sessionStorage` key `caffeineAdminToken`, (2) re-initializing access control, and (3) refreshing admin-related React Query state so the Admin Panel unlocks without a manual page refresh.

Add an animated splash/intro screen that appears before the main app UI and displays the exact text “STAR MAHARASHTRA GALAXY INTERNET”. The splash must automatically transition to the existing app (Registration/Admin views) after a short delay, and it must not require any backend changes.

Ensure the splash animation respects accessibility preferences and does not block usage: if the user has reduced-motion enabled, show a minimal/non-animated version and still transition quickly to the main UI.

Update the splash/intro screen to remove the previous animated company name text (currently rendered as “STAR MAHARASHTRA” and “GALAXY INTERNET”) and instead display the company logo and the exact tagline text: “Connect to the Future with Internet at Light Speed.”
Add the uploaded logo image to the frontend as a static asset and render it on the splash screen (do not serve images from the backend).

Adjust splash screen styling/animation so it focuses on the logo + tagline presentation (and not the old title/subtitle animations), while keeping the existing behavior: auto-transition after a short delay, fade-out on completion, and user ability to skip.

Ensure the updated splash experience continues to respect reduced-motion accessibility preferences by showing a minimal/non-animated variant when prefers-reduced-motion is enabled, while still transitioning quickly to the main UI.

Add the correct company logo image (the one previously provided by the user) to the frontend as a static asset under `frontend/public/assets/generated/`, and update the splash screen to render that corrected logo image instead of the currently referenced (incorrect) logo file.
Ensure the splash screen displays the exact tagline text: "Connect to the Future with Internet at Light Speed." (matching punctuation and capitalization exactly).

Add the correct company logo image as a static frontend asset under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and ensure the SplashScreen can load it from `/assets/generated/smgi-logo-corrected.dim_512x512.png`.

Update the Splash Screen layout so the tagline text is clearly placed directly beneath the company logo (logo on top, tagline underneath) across all responsive breakpoints, with a visually appropriate vertical spacing that reads as a single logo+tagline unit. Keep the tagline text exactly: "Connect to the Future with Internet at Light Speed."

Ensure the splash screen loads and displays the correct company logo by adding the logo image file as a static frontend asset at exactly `frontend/public/assets/generated/smgi-logo-corrected.dim_512x512.png` (or update the SplashScreen image `src` to match the actual asset filename/path that is added).

Add a safe fallback behavior in `frontend/src/components/SplashScreen.tsx` so that if the logo image fails to load (404 or other error), the UI shows a clear English message (e.g., "Logo failed to load.") instead of silently showing a broken/wrong image.

Add the newly uploaded company logo image (from the user upload “WhatsApp Image 2026-02-12 at 11.30.25-4.jpeg”) to the frontend as a static asset under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` using the filename `smgi-logo-uploaded-2026-02-12.dim_512x512.png` (512×512).

Update `frontend/src/components/SplashScreen.tsx` to render the newly uploaded logo image by changing the `` `src` to `/assets/generated/smgi-logo-uploaded-2026-02-12.dim_512x512.png`, and update the `console.error` message in `handleImageError` to reference the same new path.

Keep the splash screen tagline text exactly as: "Connect to the Future with Internet at Light Speed." and ensure the layout remains logo on top with the tagline directly beneath it across responsive breakpoints.

Update the splash/intro screen component (`frontend/src/components/SplashScreen.tsx`) to remove the company logo image entirely and instead display the company name as stylized/design lettering text: "STAR MAHARASHTRA GALAXY INTERNET".
Remove logo-specific error handling from the splash screen since the logo is no longer displayed, including removing the "Logo failed to load." fallback UI and any logo-load console error messages.
Preserve existing splash behavior: auto-transition after a short delay, fade-out on completion, user ability to skip, and respect for reduced-motion accessibility preferences.

Update the splash screen company name styling in `frontend/src/components/SplashScreen.tsx` to use a different, more stylized display font (different from the default sans) for the text "STAR MAHARASHTRA GALAXY INTERNET".
Add color styling to the splash screen company name text so it is no longer a single flat color (e.g., multi-color per word or a gradient effect), while keeping the tagline text unchanged.

Update Step 1 (Customer Details) so that when the user selects the online payment option (current UI option: "UPI"), the app clearly indicates that a payment-success receipt photo (e.g., PhonePe/Google Pay) will be required in the document upload step.

Extend Step 2 (Verification Documents) to conditionally require uploading a third file: a payment-success receipt photo, only when Step 1 Payment Option is "UPI". The UI must show the selected receipt filename, allow replacing/removing it before submission, and block moving to Step 3 until the receipt is provided when required.

Update the registration data model and submission wiring so that when a receipt file is provided it is uploaded and persisted with the registration record, and when it is not required it is omitted. Update admin registration detail viewing to show whether a receipt was uploaded for the registration.
Add a customer-facing "Print / Save" option on Step 3 (Terms and Conditions) so that after the customer accepts the terms, they can open the browser print dialog to print or save a PDF copy as proof.

Create a print-friendly layout/styling for the Terms and Conditions proof so that the printed page is readable (proper margins, legible font sizes, no clipped content), while keeping the existing on-screen Terms step layout unchanged for normal usage.

Update the Splash Screen animation background to use a space/galaxy blue color theme instead of the current primary/accent gradient, while preserving all existing splash behavior (auto-transition timing, fade-out, click-to-skip, and reduced-motion support).
Add an “Edit Details” option in the Admin Panel registration detail view that lets an authorized admin edit and save the selected registration’s editable fields using English UI text.
Extend the existing admin React Query hooks to include a mutation for updating a registration and to invalidate the relevant admin queries after success.
Fix the bug that prevents the Step 1 "Customer Details" page from opening/rendering reliably in the registration flow.
Stabilize Step validation callbacks in the registration flow so step components do not re-run validation effects due to changing function identities on every parent render.
Add a user-visible fallback UI for unexpected registration-step rendering errors so the app does not appear blank when Step 1 fails; all user-facing text must be in English.
Fix the Admin Panel so selecting a customer registration ("customer id") reliably opens the registration detail view on the right side, instead of failing to open or appearing blank.

Fix the Admin Panel so an "Edit Details" option is shown whenever a registration is selected and the user is authorized as admin, and ensure entering edit mode reliably renders the existing edit form.
Ensure Admin Panel edit-save flow remains stable after fixing the detail view, including clear save-loading/error feedback and returning to the updated detail view after a successful save.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create multi-page customer registration flow (personal details, category, payment option, router provision)
Add verification documents upload page (Aadhaar card and PAN card copy uploads)
Add terms and conditions page requiring customer agreement
Add OTP verification page (generate OTP to mobile number, enter OTP, verify)

Add backend canister support to persist completed registrations, including: customer details, chosen options (category/payment/router), terms acceptance timestamp, and references to uploaded documents. Provide a query endpoint to list/retrieve saved registrations for basic admin/testing visibility.
Add an Admin Panel with single-admin access to view customer submissions/registrations (admin-only viewer rights).
Add single-admin authorization to the backend so that viewing customer submissions is restricted to exactly one admin identity.
Secure the existing customer submissions query APIs so they are not publicly accessible to anonymous users and non-admin authenticated users.
Provide an admin credential reset / new admin login setup flow (and optionally show a clear “Logged in as Admin” status on the Admin Panel/login screen).
Implement a backend endpoint to reset/rotate the Admin Setup Code and return a newly generated code to the caller, so a user who forgot the code can regain admin access via the app.

Fix the backend `resetAdminSetupCode()` behavior so the Admin Setup Code reset flow can succeed for the legitimate admin user even when they are currently not recognized as admin by permission checks (i.e., they cannot access admin-only APIs because the setup code is missing/invalid). The backend must still prevent unauthorized users from resetting the admin setup code.
Add an animated splash/intro screen that displays “STAR MAHARASHTRA GALAXY INTERNET” before the app starts/loads the main UI.
Update splash/intro screen to remove the logo and instead display the company name in stylized/design lettering (text-based branding).
Update splash screen company name styling: change font and add color to the displayed company name text (stylized lettering).
If the user selects an Online payment option, require uploading a payment-success receipt photo (e.g., PhonePe/Google Pay receipt) as part of the registration flow.
Add a 'Print' option on the Terms & Conditions step so the customer can print/save the accepted terms as proof (after agreeing).
Change the splash/intro animation background to a space/galaxy blue color theme.
Add an Admin Panel option to edit/update a customer's profile/registration details while viewing that customer's details.

Add an admin-only backend method to update an existing customer registration’s editable fields (name, category, paymentMethod, router) for a given registration id, while keeping documents/receipt/termsAcceptedAt unchanged.
